item.title: Data visualization using ggplot2
item.description: Kaplan-Meier survival plots using survminer One Kaplan-Meier plot using survminer survminer::ggsurvplot(survfit(utotalPSM ~ integ, data = total), pval = TRUE, conf.int = TRUE, legend.title = "Hospital type", legend.labs = c("Ordinary Hospitals", "Medical Consortium Hospitals"), submain = "Kaplan-Meier plot for a pool of three patient cohorts", xlab = "Survival length of stay", palette = c("firebrick1", "green4"), font.submain = c(16, "bold")) Arrange 3 survival plots plot3cohorts = survminer::arrange_ggsurvplots( list(ggfei.m, ggwei.m, ggshiguan.m), nrow = 3, ncol = 1) Code and data.

item.title: Rmarkdown .pdf tricks
item.description: LaTeX Header To make a lot of tricks work, you need to header-includes: - \usepackage{setspace}: spacing \doublespacing \singlespacing \linespread{1.5} - \usepackage{dcolumn}: to make stargazer tables work - \usepackage{lscape}: - \AtBeginDocument{\let\maketitle\relax}: do not make title \newcommand{\blandscape}{\begin{landscape}} \newcommand{\elandscape}{\end{landscape}} - \usepackage{lineno} \linenumbers - \usepackage[bottom]{footmisc}: make footnote on the first page to bottom Make a box around the content: \fbox{\begin{minipage}{\linewidth} 1. item.title: INLA贝叶斯模型
item.description: 一些有用的参考文献： Virgilio Gómez-Rubio (2019), A gentle INLA tutorial, Haakon Bakka (2017) Small Tutorials on INLA, Wang Xiaofeng (2019) Bayesian Regression Modeling with INLA, Faraway, Julian (2016) INLA for linear mixed models.
